subject: RE: [junit] Little Help Please:  Could not invoke the suite() met hod Error
msgSnippet: I feel your pain. One of the first mods I made to junit was to add a printStackTrace() to that particular catch block and recompile. I don t really understand
messageBody:
I feel your pain.

One of the first mods I made to junit was to add a printStackTrace()
to that particular catch block and recompile.

I don't really understand why it was ommited in the first place. Getting,
"Could not
invoke the suite() method," indicates a failure in the test code, not a
failure of a test.
Adding that one stack trace made debugging my test code infinately easier.



-----Original Message-----
From: Paul Hodgetts [mailto:prh@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 5:32 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Little Help Please: Could not invoke the suite() method
Error


This is driving us nuts. We're running our main test suite via the
junit.textui.TestRunner class. We're getting an error "Could not
invoke the suite() method."

Our test class does indeed have a suite() method. We think this
test suite did run at some point prior to some rework to our build
script (but we're not sure).

We thought it had to be a class path problem, but after staring at
it for a while, we can't see any class path problems.

Looking at the source code didn't help much, since it's just
catching any exception thrown out of the invoke call, we can't tell
specifically what the exception is.

What are the typical causes of this error message? Any and all
suggestions greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
-Paul
